## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 235, 314]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[90, 339, 415, 356]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 386, 408]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 719, 433]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 325, 447]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 599, 462]]<|/det|>
You may use a pencil for any diagrams, graphs or rough working.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 599, 476]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, highlighters, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 491]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 767, 546]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units. Take the weight of \(1\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (i.e. acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 555, 604, 571]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 759, 586]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.
